*** Bug 114042 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This seems to be the problem while loading XML schema and DTD


I am also seeing this error when trying to create projects which use DTD's

We are adopting WTP M9 and see that this exception is being thrown on every J2EE
project creation. This defect needs to be addressed asap than later.
*** Bug 115334 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We cannot throw these exceptions on every project creation.  Let's try and find
out what's going on here.

Craig .. very easy to reproduce. (I could with head code). 

Oddly, I think somone somewhere is trying to "read" the schema reference 
as a dtd doctype? 

The file content created is 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<web-app id="WebApp_ID" version="2.4" xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee
http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/web-app_2_4.xsd">
	<display-name>
	Test</display-name>
	<welcome-file-list>
		<welcome-file>index.html</welcome-file>
		<welcome-file>index.htm</welcome-file>
		<welcome-file>index.jsp</welcome-file>
		<welcome-file>default.html</welcome-file>
		<welcome-file>default.htm</welcome-file>
		<welcome-file>default.jsp</welcome-file>
	</welcome-file-list>
</web-app>


I am also (still) seeing the message mentioned in comment #2, when I open the
xml editor on above file. 

I tried using the content in a "normal" xml file (not web.xml) and it seemed fine. 

Lawrence, I'm adding you to CC list, to assess if hte message in comment #2 is
related ... or a seperate bug that desires its own bugzilla?

Just by looking at comment #2 it looks like the result returned from the cache
is not being used properly by org.eclipse.wst.xsd.contentmodel. Likely the
component is only using the URI resolver resolvePhysical method and not the
resolve method as well. This may be due to a limitation in the model (if I
correctly remember an earlier conversation I had with Craig).

I've opened bug 116120 to track this separate problem.

FYI, when I attempt to reproduce this using the file David pasted into the
comment above (thanks David) I see a stack like this in the error log...

*** Bug 116120 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This should be fixed now.  I did notice that our DOM model seems to be overly aggressive about loading grammar models.  In this use case it doesn't appear that the EMF2DOMAdapter would actually make any use of the grammar model.  I've opened bug 117232 to investigate what may be a potential performance issue.
